meanings.definition: The quality or state of being transparent.
meanings.sent1: The transparencies of the glass allowed light to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used transparencies on the overhead projector to show diagrams to the class.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved making objects disappear behind the transparencies.
meanings.sent4: Her honesty was like the transparencies of a crystal-clear lake, revealing everything.
meanings.sent5: The transparencies of the plastic wrap made it easy to see the contents inside.

meanings.sent1: The transparencies of the water in the pond allowed us to see the fish swimming.
meanings.sent2: The transparencies of her explanation made the complex topic easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: The transparencies of his excuse were so obvious that nobody believed him.
meanings.sent4: The transparencies of her intentions were as clear as a cloudless sky.
meanings.sent5: The transparencies of the glass made it difficult to distinguish it from air.

meanings.definition: The ability to see through or perceive something clearly.
meanings.sent1: His transparencies in decision-making made it easy for others to trust him.
meanings.sent2: The transparencies of her emotions were evident in her facial expressions.
meanings.sent3: The detective's transparencies in solving the case impressed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The transparencies of her thoughts were like an open book to those who knew her well.
meanings.sent5: The transparencies of the glass window allowed her to see the beautiful garden outside.
